intro: Crotalaria sertulifera, commonly known as the clustered crownflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in open grasslands and disturbed soils. Its seed pods are cylindrical and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Crotalaria sertulifera is also noted for its nitrogen-fixing ability, making it useful in soil enrichment.
